page.title: 19The Village of Swepstone
page.content: The Norman Church of St. Peter is used on Sundays when the Vicar, Mr. Greenwood, comes from Appleby Magna to conduct the services. There have not been any recent notable events in the village. The only local customs are Church festivals, apart from the Vegetable Society Festival, which takes place in August. The village's principle feature is the Chicken Factory, the only industry in Swepstone. It employs 22 people, only 2 being locals. The birds arrive frozen and oven-ready, and are thawed and cooked in steam coolers. They turn over 25,000 chickens a week. The factory has been going for 8 years, the buildings and land covering approximately 6 acres. There are no major roadways, waterways or train lines nearby, nor is there any gas.
